dt.t: the {wi}nationality{/wi} of Ireland is in her songs and in her stories, and in her chronicles and in her tradition

dt: {bc}a legal relationship involving allegiance on the part of an individual and usually protection on the part of the state
{bc}political independence or existence as a separate nation
{bc}a people having a common origin, tradition, and language and capable of forming or actually constituting a nation-state

dt.t: The diverse {it}nationalities{/it} of the Austro-Hungarian Empire desired independence.

dt: {bc}an ethnic group constituting one element of a larger unit (such as a nation)

dt.t: The country is home to five {it}nationalities{/it}.

shortdef: national status; specifically : a legal relationship involving allegiance on the part of an individual and usually protection on the part of the state
